status.body:
This is where you put a plain summary of today — how you're doing, what treatment or recovery looks like right now, and what would actually be helpful from the people around you (or what you'd rather they didn't do).

You don't owe anyone positivity here. If it's hard, say it's hard. If you're okay, say that too. This section is the one most worth keeping current.

entries.title: First thing that happened
entries.body: Describe what happened here. Write it in your own voice — this is your story, not a medical chart. You can be as detailed or as brief as you want. If something is still difficult to write about, a single sentence is enough.

entries.title: Something that developed over time
entries.body:
This is another entry. You can use the tags to indicate whether something is resolved, still ongoing, or the current focus of treatment.

Add as many of these entries as you need. The timeline runs oldest first.

entries.title: Where things stand right now
entries.body: Your most recent entry. This is the thing you're dealing with right now. Write it plainly. People will understand more than you expect, and the ones who matter will be glad they read it.
